Operation 'delete-/crm/v3/objects/companies/{companyId}_archive' has semantic quality issues: inconsistent_terminology, missing_side_effects. Summary correctly uses 'Archive' terminology consistent with the operation name and API context. However, description uses 'Delete' which is inconsistent with the summary and operation semantics. Added clarification that this is a soft delete (archival) rather than permanent deletion, and explained the restoration window as a side effect for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Delete a company by ID. Deleted companies can be restored within 90 days of deletion. Learn more about [restoring records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).
data.description_suggestion: Archive a company by ID. Archived companies can be restored within 90 days of archival. This operation performs a soft delete, preserving the company record for potential restoration. Learn more about [restoring records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/restore-deleted-records).
data.reasoning: Summary correctly uses 'Archive' terminology consistent with the operation name and API context. However, description uses 'Delete' which is inconsistent with the summary and operation semantics. Added clarification that this is a soft delete (archival) rather than permanent deletion, and explained the restoration window as a side effect for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Merge two company records. Learn more about [merging records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/merge-records).
data.description_suggestion: Merge two company records into a single record. Requires specifying the primary company ID and the company ID to merge into it via the request body. The secondary company record will be archived, and its associations will be transferred to the primary record. Returns the merged company object. Learn more about [merging records](https://knowledge.hubspot.com/records/merge-records).

data.current_description: Update a batch of companies by ID.
data.description_suggestion: Update multiple companies in a single request by their IDs. Accepts a batch input object containing company IDs and property updates. Returns a batch response with updated company objects and any errors encountered. Partial updates are supported - only provided properties will be modified. Responses may include status 200 for full success or 207 for partial success with some failures.
data.reasoning: Current description is too minimal. Added details about batch input structure, return format, partial update support, and explanation of 200/207 response codes to help AI agents understand the operation's behavior and when to use it.

message: Operation 'get-/crm/v3/objects/companies_getPage' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. data.current_description: Retrieve all companies, using query parameters to control the information that gets returned.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve a paginated list of companies with customizable filtering and field selection. Supports query parameters to control pagination (limit, after), property selection (properties), associations (associations), and sorting. Returns a paginated response containing company objects and a next page token for pagination. Use the after parameter with the next page token to retrieve subsequent pages.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about available parameters and pagination behavior. Enhanced version explains key query parameters, pagination mechanism, and return structure to enable AI agents to construct proper requests and handle paginated responses.

message: Operation 'post-/crm/v3/objects/companies/batch/upsert_upsert' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Current description explains idProperty but lacks clarity on upsert behavior, input structure, and response format. Enhanced version clarifies the create-vs-update logic, explains the matching mechanism, and documents response codes and structure for better AI agent understanding of operation effects.

data.current_summary: Create or update a batch of companies by unique property values
data.current_description: Create or update companies identified by a unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query parameter. `idProperty` query param refers to a property whose values are unique for the object.
data.description_suggestion: Create or update multiple companies in a single request using a unique property identifier. The `idProperty` query parameter specifies which property contains unique values for matching existing companies. If a company with the matching property value exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new company will be created. Returns a batch response with created/updated company objects and any errors encountered. Responses may include status 200 for full success or 207 for partial success with some failures.
data.reasoning: Current description explains idProperty but lacks clarity on upsert behavior, input structure, and response format. Enhanced version clarifies the create-vs-update logic, explains the matching mechanism, and documents response codes and structure for better AI agent understanding of operation effects.

data.current_description: Search for companies by filtering on properties, searching through associations, and sorting results. Learn more about [CRM search](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/guides/api/crm/search#make-a-search-request).
data.description_suggestion: Search for companies using advanced filtering, association traversal, and sorting capabilities. Accepts a PublicObjectSearchRequest containing filter groups, association searches, and sort specifications. Returns a paginated list of matching company objects with their properties and associations. Supports complex queries combining multiple filter conditions and association-based searches. Use this operation for sophisticated company discovery beyond simple property filtering.
data.reasoning: Original description is vague about input/output structure and capabilities. Enhanced version specifies the request schema type, explains key search capabilities (filters, associations, sorting), describes the response format, and clarifies when to use this operation versus basic retrieval for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Create or update a batch of companies by unique property values
data.current_description: Create or update companies identified by a unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query parameter. `idProperty` query param refers to a property whose values are unique for the object.
data.description_suggestion: Create or update multiple companies in a single request using a unique property identifier. Specify the unique property via the `idProperty` query parameter. If a company with the matching property value exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new company will be created. Returns a batch response with created/updated company objects and any errors. Responses may include status 207 indicating partial success.
